intro: Gingidium antipodum, commonly known as the New Zealand ginger, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features rhizomatous growth and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are broad, elliptical, and have a distinct, aromatic scent. It is often used in traditional Māori medicine for its purported health benefits.
